intro: Chiloglottis grammata, commonly known as the black spider orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its dark, almost black, hairy leaves and its unique, spider-like flower structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its flowers, which are usually pale green or yellow, are pollinated by specific insect species. Chiloglottis grammata is a rare and endangered species, requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
